pixelmon.npc.dialogue.shopkeeper.daycare: Nursery Trader
Nursery Trader
Gemmologist
Gemmologist
Welcome! I have a variety of portable day cares for you to choose from, for a price.
If you feel like you need to complete your set, come back and see me.
Hello there! Can I interest you in this fine selection of precious gemstones?
Come again! Just don't tell Officer Jenny about this...
Welcome to the Aurelia Town Daycare Shop! Looking to raise dragons or just keep eggs warm in the snow? I’ve got what you need.
If you’re missing any cosy dens for your partners, come back anytime. The mountains remember every guest.
Ah, a collector of treasures! These gems gleam like dragon eyes under the northern lights... interested in a rare evolution stone?
Come back soon! And, between us, the dragons never mind a little extra sparkle...
Welcome to the Argentite Valley Daycare Depot! High up on the plateau, we keep Pokémon safe and charged. Looking for something portable?
If you’re still searching for that perfect spark, you know where to find me.
Hello there, collector! These gemstones shine with the energy of a desert thunderstorm. Looking to evolve with a little extra electricity?
Come back for more! Your secret’s safe on the savannah breeze...
Welcome to Rosealite Town Day Care! Your Pokémon will feel right at home.
If you need another forest hideaway for your team, come and find me by the big birch tree.
Hello! These gemstones hold the magic of birch groves, perfect for evolving your fairy friends.
See you soon! The forest’s secrets are safe with us.
Looking for a safe haven in all this lava? Carnelia Town Day Care is built to withstand Nether heat, ideal for your Pokémon while you challenge Pyra.
If you need another rest stop on your blazing journey, we’re always here, flames and all.
Looking for something special? These evolution stones hold the power of the Nether.
Come back any time! May your evolutions burn as bright as the Nether’s own fire.
Looking for somewhere for your Pokémon to rest? The Onyxia Hollow Day Care is woven with soul sand, where only the bravest or most spectral feel at ease.
If you feel called back, the doors always creak open for you.
These stones hold the valley’s spectral power. Fancy an evolution a world apart?
Return any time... your secret is safe in the mist.
Need a break? Peridot Vale Daycare is tucked beneath the thickest branches. Pokémon nap best with birds singing and a breeze in the leaves.
If you ever need a safe patch of grass for your team, we’re only a short walk away.
You’ve got an eye for nature! These stones are found beneath old roots—perfect for Trainers seeking real forest power.
Come again! Don’t worry, we won’t tell Heath how you found your advantage.
This isn’t any fancy resort... just good honest daycare, rough and ready like the badlands!
Your Pokémon will be tougher than terracotta when you get them back!
Pssst... fancy buying some rare mesa minerals? Perfect for evolution... and discretion.
Keep those stones hidden... the canyon walls have ears!
Our Sapphira Town Daycare has igloos that are warmer than an Alolan Vulpix's fur. Your Pokémon won't freeze solid here!
Collect before nightfall. Frost rot ruined three incubators last moon.
Pssst... genuine ice rock? Perfect for evolving Eevees into Glaceon. No questions asked.
Hide those before the avalanche patrol checks your rucksack. They're sticklers about mining permits.
Our Chromia Town Daycare’s built like a Bastiodon, no sandstorm’s getting in! Unlike SOME gym challengers.
Collections before dusk. The wild Aggron herd likes to... inspect the fences.
Psst... ‘found’ some metal coats near the scrapyard. Perfect for Scizor evolutions. No paperwork.
Keep quiet. The Steelix in the canyon swallows loose tongues.
Lazuline Town Daycare’s safer than a Lapras’s shell! ...Unless the giant Octillery rumours are true. (They’re not. Probably.)
Pickups at high tide only. We’re not fishing your Pokémon out of the bay again.
Psst... ‘found’ some Water Stones in a shipwreck. Perfect for evolving. No customs officers asked.
Keep it dry. The harbour patrol’s Sharpedo can smell contraband.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.shopkeeper.pokemar: Welcome to my Poké Mart. I hope you find something you like!
See you next time.
Hi, welcome to the Poké Mart. Would you like any help?
Bye then. Visit us again soon.
Hello, may I help you find your Pokémon equipment? We have some great bargains.
Thank you for your custom. We look forward to serving you again.
Hello, and welcome to the Poké Mart. I am sure the quality of our goods will please you.
Delighted to have met you. Good day.
Welcome to our lovely shop. We have an exciting range of luxury goods.
Thank you for shopping with us.
Hello, and welcome! We have a splendid selection of food items for you today!
Please let me know if you need anything else.
Welcome, traveller, to the Aurelia Town Poké Mart, where dragons soar and the snow never melts! Warm yourself and browse our goods.
Stay warm out there, may the mountain winds guide you back.
Greetings, brave one! Looking for supplies strong enough for a dragon’s den or a blizzard’s bite? Just ask if you need advice.
Farewell! May your next journey be as swift as a Salamence in flight.
Ah, a challenger! In these icy peaks, only the best kit will do. Can I help you find something to conquer dragons or snowstorms?
Thank you for braving the cold to shop with us. Return soon, there’s always more to discover beneath the snow.
Welcome to the scale-adorned mart! Our TMs are forged for those who dream of dragons and mountain victories.
May your Pokémon master both fang and frost. Safe travels!
Welcome, friend! Even in the heart of a blizzard, luxury awaits. Perhaps a dragon-scale envelope for your next letter?
May your messages soar like a Dragonite above the clouds.
Come in, warm up! From spicy curry to sweet treats, we have meals fit for a dragon. Perfect after a trek through powder snow.
Let me know if you need seconds, or a toasty treat for your journey!
Welcome to Argentite Valley Mart! The sun’s blazing, the cliffs are high, and there’s always a spark in the air. See anything that gives you a jolt?
Catch you on the next current, and keep your feet on the ground and your head in the storm.
Hey there, traveller! The plateau winds carry electricity. Do you need a hand powering up for your journey?
Zap by anytime! There’s always more to discover where the sky meets the stone.
Hello, welcome! Our gear’s as tough as the savannah sun and twice as charged. What do you need for your team?
Thanks for letting us spark up your supplies. Come back when you’re running low on volts!
Welcome to the thunderhead of TMs! Everything here is chosen for Trainers who like their moves fast and fierce.
Hope you leave with a spring in your step. Stay shock-proof out there!
Step inside, out of the glare! We stock luxury goods fit for the flashiest Trainers... perhaps a lightning-bolt letter for a friend?
Thanks for shopping! May your messages reach their mark as quickly as lightning.
Hungry from all that hiking? Our food will put a spark in your step. Spicy, zesty, and made for life on the plateau!
Need a recharge? Come back any time for a taste that crackles!
Welcome to the Rosealite Town Poké Mart, nestled among the birch trees! The guardian of the forest says there’s always something special here, so have a look around.
Take care beneath the birch leaves, and we hope to see you on the woodland path again.
Hi there! Looking for supplies to help your Pokémon flourish among the flowers and mushrooms? Let me know if you need a tip.
See you next time! May a Comfey garland light your way.
Welcome! We have supplies perfect for Trainers exploring the birch forests. Perhaps you’ll spot a Sylveon or a Floette out there!
Thanks for stopping by. Come back whenever you need a break from the tall grass.
Hello, and welcome! Our TMs sparkle with woodland energy!
May your moves bloom as brightly as a Flower Forest in spring.
Step into the shade! Our luxury goods include paper made from birch bark. Fairy-approved for sending magical post.
Thank you! May your letters travel safely by Cutiefly courier.
Welcome! Try a fresh batch of our curry, favourites of Pokémon who call the birch woods home.
Let me know if you or your Pokémon need another treat after your next adventure!
Welcome to the Carnelia Town Poké Mart! Only the bravest Trainers shop beneath the Nether’s blazing sky. Let the heat fire up your journey!
Stay cool in the heat and may your path lead you back through the flames.
Hello there! Need supplies tough enough to withstand lava flows and fire-type Pokémon? Just ask; Gym Leader Pyra relies on us for her hardest battles.
Take care! If you feel the burn, you know where to find us.
Hot deals for a hot biome! We’ve got what you need for crossing magma seas and facing Pyra’s blazing Gym.
Thanks for stopping by the Poké Mart. Come back before your potions evaporate!
Welcome! Our TMs are heat-tested in the Nether, which is perfect for learning fire moves or keeping up with Pyra’s Gym challenges.
Good luck out there! May your Pokémon’s fire burn ever brighter.
In need of something special? Even in a world of netherrack and flame, a luxury item or two can really spark up your adventure.
Thanks for shopping! Safe travels, and may your letters avoid the lava lakes.
Welcome, Trainer! After a trek through the Nether Wastes, nothing hits the spot like a hot curry or a spicy treat for your Pokémon.
Let me know if you need a refill, my stew is always bubbling!
Welcome... to the Onyxia Hollow Poké Mart of echoes and drifting souls. Something here may find you, even if you’re not searching for it.
May the spirits guide you back through the valley, someday.
Greetings, traveller. Not many linger in a soul sand valley. If you seek supplies, or secrets; just ask... though Marisol rarely does.
Farewell. Watch your step in the fog. Some say it whispers your name.
Welcome to a Mart unlike any other. Here, in the blue glow of soul fire, you’ll find items even Duskull would envy.
Thank you for visiting. Shadows always remember a friendly face.
Step softly... our TMs are chosen for battles in the spectral silence. Even Marisol trusts them for her rare appearances.
May your moves be as mysterious as the valley itself.
Welcome, or perhaps... welcome back? We stock elegant, otherworldly items—parchment as pale as Phantump bark.
Thank you. May your messages reach across any distance... or plane.
Peckish? Our treats might give you chills... perfect for a Gastly’s midnight snack or a lonely wanderer.
Fancy another taste? Just listen for the wind. It carries my voice.
Careful stepping in, as roots love to trip visitors! Welcome to the Peridot Vale Poké Mart, where everything’s just that little bit greener.
Watch out for Sudowoodo blocking the path home!
Hey, forest explorer! Heath says the best Trainers pack snacks and a spare repel. Need help finding either?
Take care! Wild Oddish are known to stow away in rucksacks around here.
Lost in the leaves? Happens to the best of us. Our bargains are easier to spot than a wild Shroomish—promise!
Next time you get caught up in vines, you know where to find us.
You’ve got mud on your boots—perfect! Heath’s Gym battles are all about keeping your feet on the ground. Need a TM to help your team flourish beneath the trees?
Go and make Heath proud. And don’t let any Lurantis outshine you!
Leaf mail, moss paper, and floral ink—we’re serious about forest correspondence. Write home, or send a note to Heath if you dare!
Thanks for choosing us! The forest always knows how to deliver a letter.
Feeling peckish? Our berry bowls and sweet root snacks are famous—just ask any Gossifleur loitering by the berry bushes.
Want seconds? Just follow your nose—or the Wooloo. They never miss a meal.
Welcome to the Garnet Plateau Poké Mart. We’ve got sturdy kit for tough trainers!
Safe travels through the canyons, mate.
Howdy! Need supplies for Clayton’s Gym challenge? We’ve got what you need.
Don’t let the tumbleweeds slow you down. Come back soon!
Greetings, traveller! Our wares are as reliable as the earth itself. What’ll it be?
May your path be as steady as a Hippowdon’s stride.
Dig this – finest Ground-type TMs west of Mt. Silver!
Remember, when in doubt, Earthquake ‘em out!
Howdy, partner! We’ve got desert-proof mail items tougher than a Krookodile’s hide.
You all come back now, you hear?
Hungry as a Mudsdale? Try our special mesa-spiced curries!
Save some for your Pokémon, they’ll need energy for Clayton’s Gym!
Welcome to the Sapphira Town Poké Mart. Stock up before that blizzard rolls in!
Wrap up warm out there. That last snowdrift buried three trainers.
Good day! Need cold weather kit for Lady Frostine's Gym? Our thermal potions have just arrived.
May your steps be lighter than a Snom on fresh powder.
Hail and well met! Our supplies are as reliable as a Mamoswine in a snowstorm. What can I melt for you?
Keep warm. The ice caves claimed another careless trainer yesterday.
Chilly greetings! Our Ice-type TMs are colder than Regice's stare. Aurora Veil special this week.
May your battles be as precise as Lady Frostine's Glaceon.
Welcome! Our glacial crystal postboxes survive even Weavile attacks. Fennekin-proof too!
Remember to thaw your ink before writing. Again.
Hot meals here! Try our Abomasnow chilli before the Bergmite migration blocks the roads.
Careful with spices near Ice Pokémon. Last week's Vanilluxe incident was... messy.
Welcome to the Chromia Town Poké Mart. Our wares are tougher than Ferrum’s Mawile’s jaws, guaranteed.
Watch for Excadrill burrows on your way out. Last trainer who didn’t? Well... let’s just say their shoes are still stuck.
Greetings, traveller. Need heat-resistant gear? Savannah sun melts weak steel, but not our stock.
Come back before the dry winds warp your Poké Balls. Again.
Hail and gears! We’ve got tactical gear even Aegislash would envy. What’s your strategy?
Pro tip: Bring Ground-types. Half the challengers forget Magnezone’s Air Balloon.
Steel yourself, our TMs hit harder than Corviknight’s Body Press. Flash Cannon surplus today!
May your battles be as balanced as Ferrum’s team.
Ever seen a luxury postbox deflect a sandstorm? Ours do. We test with Durant swarms.
Rustproof guarantee or your money back!
Hungry? Try our forge-fired curry. Spicier than a Scizor’s Bullet Punch!
Warning: Do not feed to Magnemite. Last incident took three hoses to cool down.
Ahoy! Welcome to Lazuline Town Poké Mart. Our stock’s fresher than the morning catch!
Fair winds, trainer. Watch out for Tentacool near the docks, they’ve been nippy lately.
Welcome aboard! Need supplies before challenging Nereus? Our potions are leak-proof, guaranteed.
Don’t forget: Gym’s low tide hours only. Missed it? Try the seafood stall until dusk.
Splashing in, are we? Grab a waterproof bag. Last week’s storm soaked three trainers’ TMs.
The tide’s turning soon. Hurry, or you’ll be kayaking back to shore.
Dive straight in! Our Water-type TMs could make a Magikarp competitive. Well, almost.
May your battles flow like Nereus’s Ludicolo in a rainstorm.
Fancy some driftwood-carved postboxes? Waterproof, buoyant, and Wingull-proof!
PS: If a Finnegan steals your letter, check the eastern reef. They hoard shiny things.
Peckish? Our kelp-wrapped curries are a favourite with Water-types. Just... perhaps avoid the Spice Bomb if you’re boarding a boat later.
Complimentary Pecha Berry with every meal... last week’s food poisoning incident won’t happen again.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.generic: Hello there! Welcome to the Pokémon Centre. Would you like me to heal your Pokémon?
Your Pokémon are fully healed! Please take care on your journey.
Hello there! Welcome to the Pokémon Centre. Would you like me to heal your Pokémon?
Your Pokémon are fully healed! Please take care on your journey.
Welcome, traveller, to Aurelia Town Pokémon Centre. The winds may howl outside, but inside, your team will rest as peacefully as a Dragonair in its den. Shall I heal your Pokémon?
Your Pokémon are fully healed and ready to soar the peaks once more! May the mountain protect you on your journey.
Braving the blizzards, are you? Step in from the cold. Here at Aurelia Town Pokémon Centre everyone deserves a place to recover. Let me restore your Pokémon’s strength.
Your team is in top shape! Venture forth, and may your bond with your Pokémon be as unbreakable as dragon’s scale.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.electri: Welcome to the Argentite Valley Pokémon Centre! Take a seat and let your team recharge. Would you like me to heal your Pokémon?
All healed up! May your journey through Argentite Valley stay bright and full of sparks.
Hey there, Trainer! The air’s alive with energy in Argentite Valley. Let me give your Pokémon a quick boost.
Your Pokémon are at full charge! Travel safely, and watch out for lightning on those high plateaux.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.fairy.n: Welcome to the Rosealite Town Pokémon Centre! The birch leaves whisper of your arrival! Would you like me to heal your Pokémon?
Your Pokémon are all healed and bright as forest blossoms! May the woodland spirits guide your journey.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.fairy.d: Ah, a visitor to Rosealite Town! Tread softly, the woods are full of magic. Shall I help your Pokémon feel their best?
Your Pokémon are in perfect health. Travel safely beneath the birch trees and may fairy lights guide your way.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.fire.nu: Welcome to the Carnelia Town Pokémon Centre! Come in out of the heat. Would you like me to heal your Pokémon before you brave the flames again?
Your Pokémon are fully healed! May your steps stay cool on these blazing paths.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.fire.do: Hello, Trainer! It’s always hot in Carnelia Town, but we’ll have your Pokémon feeling refreshed in no time. Ready for a quick heal?
All sorted! May your team’s fire burn even brighter, and mind those lava flows out there.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.ghost.n: Welcome to Onyxia Hollow Pokémon Centre... Where the mist lingers and spirits find peace. Shall I heal your Pokémon?
Your Pokémon are fully healed. May the shadows watch over you until you return.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.ghost.d: Ah, another visitor braving the valley. In Onyxia Hollow, even restless souls need rest. Would you like me to tend to your Pokémon?
Your team is restored. Travel softly, the fog remembers every step.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.grass.n: Welcome to the Peridot Vale Pokémon Centre! Shake off the pollen and step inside. Would you like me to heal your Pokémon?
Your Pokémon are fresh as spring leaves! Stay sharp... roots and wild Pokémon love to surprise travellers.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.grass.d: Ah, a forest wanderer! At Peridot Vale, we know a rest among the ferns can heal any team. Shall I tend to your Pokémon?
All set! May the forest’s shade and song guide you safely on your way.
Howdy, partner! Welcome to the Garnet Plateau Pokémon Centre. Dust off your boots and let me patch up your team. You ready for a heal?
Your Pokémon are tough as old boots! Safe travels through the canyons, but don’t let the sun catch you unprepared.
Welcome in from the badlands! Out here in Garnet Plateau, we know a thing or two about endurance. Want your Pokémon sorted out?
Your team’s good as new. Remember, a steady step keeps you safe on rocky roads.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.ice.nur: Welcome to the Sapphira Town Pokémon Centre! Warm up by the fire and let me heal your Pokémon before the next snowstorm hits.
Your Pokémon are fit and frost-free! Bundle up tight out there... these blizzards don’t play fair.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.ice.doc: Braved the cold, did you? In Sapphira Town, every team deserves a little extra care. Shall I restore your Pokémon’s strength?
All healed! May the northern lights light your path and your toes stay toasty.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.steel.n: Welcome to the Chromia Town Pokémon Centre! Wipe your boots, those metal shavings get everywhere. Ready for me to restore your Pokémon?
Your team’s fit as forged steel! Watch out for wild Magnemite on your way out.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.steel.d: Good to see you in Chromia Town! This clinic’s built tougher than a Bastiodon. Shall I patch up your Pokémon?
All healed. Travel sharp, and may your path be as smooth as polished metal.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.water.n: Welcome to Lazuline Town Pokémon Centre! Dry off and take a seat. Would you like me to heal your Pokémon?
Your Pokémon are shipshape and ready for the tides ahead! Watch your step on the docks, they get slippery at high tide.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.pokecenter.water.d: Ahoy, Trainer! In Lazuline Town, even the toughest team needs a break from the surf. Shall I patch up your Pokémon?
All healed and seaworthy! Good luck out there, and don’t let a Wingull pinch your lunch.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.lady.title: Carer June
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.man.title: Carer June
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.forms.1: Have you ever used a nursery before, dearie? Once you have one, you can just right click it to see a menu.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.forms.2: Pop two of your Pokémon into the slots, and then press the green tick!
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.forms.3: If your Pokémon have alternate forms, like from Galar or Alola, use the yellow arrows to select them.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.forms.4: You can have up to 3 ranches in operation at a time, and you can check on them from the tab at the top of your inventory!
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.item.1: Ah, it's good to see you! Have you had a chance to use the Daycare Blocks yet?
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.item.2: You may have noticed that your Pokémon may occasionally request items when in the daycare.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.item.3: In order for them to feel more comfortable, I'd recommend gathering the items to fulfil these requests.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.daycare.item.4: Once you have them in your inventory, just press the green tick. If you get all of them, you may eventually get yourself an egg!
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.utility.hairdresse: Hairdresser
Master of Dandy Styles
Welcome to the height of elegance! Shall I give your Furfrou a most dashing trim?
Pray tell, which splendid Furfrou shall I adorn with the finest Dandy flair?
No Furfrou, no fashion! Please select one to continue.
No Furfrou present? What a fashion faux pas!
Splendid! Your Furfrou now exudes dandy distinction!
Hairdresser
Maestro of Debutante Elegance
Welcome to a world of grace and glamour! Shall I prepare your Furfrou for its grand début?
Which darling Furfrou shall I prepare for its society debut?
A debut without a Furfrou? Perish the thought! Please choose one to continue.
Why, there's no Furfrou with you! The soirée simply cannot commence!
Radiant! Your Furfrou is now ready to turn heads at any gathering.
Hairdresser
Champion of Natural Beauty
Hello, sometimes the best style is the one you're born with! Would you like your Furfrou’s natural look restored?
Which Furfrou would you like to see in its classic, natural style?
No Furfrou selected! Can’t go natural if there’s no Furfrou, right?
Whoops, I don’t see any Furfrou with you at the moment!
All done! Your Furfrou looks as stunning as ever in its natural form.
Hairdresser
Stargazing Stylist
Ah, shall we transform your Furfrou with a trim inspired by the stars above?
Which Furfrou is ready for a look that’s simply stellar?
You’ll need to pick a Furfrou if you want a trim worthy of the night sky.
Looks like your party is missing a Furfrou... no star styles tonight!
All finished! Your Furfrou now twinkles with a starry brilliance.
Hairdresser
Matronly Stylist
Welcome, let’s give your Furfrou a look full of poise and gentle refinement.
Which of your Furfrou will step into a style of stately charm?
You’ll need to pick a Furfrou to receive a nurturing touch of elegance.
No Furfrou with you? The Matron trim must wait for a worthy candidate.
All done! Your Furfrou wears the Matron style with dignity and grace.
Hairdresser
Stylist of Affection
Oh, your Furfrou is about to fall head over heels for this look!
Not every trim is for today... return when you sense a touch of romance in the air.
Which of your Furfrou is ready to wear their heart on their tail?
No Furfrou chosen? My heart aches to make one lovely!
Bring your Furfrou along, and I’ll have my heart-shaped scissors at the ready!
There you are, your Furfrou is sure to steal hearts wherever it goes!
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.battle.arena.stall: Just like us, Pokémon can have a unique Nature that makes them different from another of the same species.
These Natures affect your Pokémon by increasing one of their stats, but lowering another.
A Pokémon's Nature can have a big effect on that Pokémon's performance, but there are 25 different ones.
Finding the right Nature can be difficult, but can prove to be useful in turning the tide of a battle in your favour.
Do you know about Pokémon Individual Values? The higher the IV value, the higher that stat will be for the Pokémon!
I always try to get my Pokémon to have as high an IV as possible to make my Pokémon even stronger!
I heard the best way to increase the IVs of your Pokémon is breeding. The parent Pokémon can pass their IV stats onto the egg!
There's also an item you can have your Pokémon hold while breeding that can increase the number of IVs passed through genetics!
When Pokémon gain experience after a battle, they'll also gain some Effort Values in their stats.
The Effort Values they gain will depend on the type of Pokémon they defeated. They can only gain so many, so plan carefully!
Want a tip? If you have a Pokémon hold a Power item, like a Power Band, it increases a specific EV they receive from battle!
It will increase an EV even if the defeated Pokémon doesn't normally provide it, it's really useful for training your Pokémon!
Gym Leader
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.battle.trainer.gym: Gym Novice
Gym Trainer
Gym Veteran
You must rest your wings. Return in a day to challenge the Dragon Gym again.
So, you've made it to the top of the Dragon's Tower? Impressive! Prepare to face the might of my dragons!
Even the strongest fall sometimes. Train hard and return to earn your place among the dragons!
Dragon Gym Leader: Pulao
My dragons sense you are not ready yet. Return when you can withstand their power.
Incredible! You have soared above the challenge and earned the Legend Badge!
You’ll need to wait a day before you can challenge my current! Come back later.
Welcome challenger! My Electric-type team will light up the battlefield. Ready to get shocked?
You’ve been overloaded! The surge of my Pokémon was too much for you.
Electric Gym Leader: Tesla
Now isn’t the time for a battle. Please try again soon.
You’ve withstood every shock and surge! Take the Bolt Badge, you’ve earnt it!
Even magic needs time to recharge. Return in a day if you wish to challenge me again.
Welcome to my realm of dreams and wonder! The Fairy-type holds more power than you may imagine—prepare to be enchanted.
The magic of my Fairy-types prevails once more! Do not give up—every story has its twists.
Fairy Gym Leader: Rosalind
Your Pokémon are too weary to face my fairy tale—come back when they’re ready for magic!
You’ve unravelled the spell and bested my team! Wear the Fairy Badge proudly, champion of dreams.
You’ve already faced me today! Come back in a day.
You’ve made it this far, but can you handle the heat of my fiery spirit? Let’s battle!
Don’t be disheartened. Sometimes you must walk through fire before you can rise again.
Fire Gym Leader: Pyra
You look burnt out! Heal your Pokémon before facing my flames.
Impressive! You’ve withstood my flames. Here’s the Volcano Badge, wear it with pride!
The spirits need time to recover before another challenge. Come back in a day.
The shadows beckon you forward... Are you brave enough to face me and my spectral partners?
The shadows swallow your hopes... but do not despair. Train harder and the spirits may yet favour you.
Ghost Gym Leader: Marisol
Even the most courageous can falter. Return when your Pokémon are ready to face the unknown.
You shine through the darkness! Accept the Fog Badge, and the respect of all spirits you have bested.
The forest needs time to regrow. Return in a day and we shall battle anew!
Welcome to the verdant arena! My team is as deep-rooted as the ancient woods... can you weather the storm?
The cycle continues... my roots hold strong. Challenge me again when you are ready!
Grass Gym Leader: Heath
Your team has wilted. Rest up before facing my garden’s challenge.
Like the mightiest wind, you have overcome my garden. Take this Plant Badge as proof of your triumph!
You must wait a day before challenging me again. Rest up and return when you’re ready to face the might of the ground!
Welcome to the Ground Gym! Are you ready to feel the power of the earth itself? Let’s see if you can withstand my ground-shaking team!
Looks like the ground was too tough for you this time. Don’t let it shake your spirit, train harder and try again!
Ground Gym Leader: Clayton
Your Pokémon are in no condition to battle. Come back when your team is ready to rumble!
Incredible! You stood strong against the might of the earth and triumphed. Take this Quake Badge as proof of your victory!
Sorry, challenger! You'll need to wait a day before taking me on again.
Welcome to my gym! The cold here is nothing compared to the chill of defeat. Show me if your team can handle the ice!
Looks like the cold was too much for you this time. Come back when you're ready to take on the Ice Gym again!
Ice Gym Leader: Frostine
You can't challenge the Ice Gym with all your Pokémon fainted. Heal up and face the freeze!
Incredible! Your battling spirit burns colder than the harshest blizzard. Here, take the Icicle Badge as proof of your victory!
My Pokémon need to recover before I can accept another challenge. Return in a day.
You’ve come to challenge my iron will? The Steel Gym will test your endurance and your strategy. Let’s see if you can withstand the pressure!
Steel endures, but you’ve buckled under the pressure this time. Train harder and return when you’re ready!
Steel Gym Leader: Ferrum
You can’t challenge me when you have no Pokémon left able to battle. Return with your team prepared!
Incredible! Your strength and tactics have overcome my steel defence. You’ve earned the Coal Badge, and my respect.
You've already faced the currents today! Return in a day.
Welcome challenger! The tides are in my favour today... let's see if you can weather the storm!
The sea is unpredictable, but don't give up! Come back when you’re ready to try again.
Water Gym Leader: Nereus
Your Pokémon need rest before braving the open seas. Heal up, then return.
Incredible! You've mastered the flow of battle. Take this as proof of your victory!
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.battle.trainer.gym: Dragons need their rest. Come back in a day to challenge me again.
You’ll have to get past my dragons if you want to see our leader!
Looks like your journey continues! Train harder and try again.
Gym Novice: Aliene
Sorry, you're not ready to face the dragons right now.
Wow, you’re even stronger than I thought. Perhaps you’re worthy of the Dragon Leader!
Dragons need their rest. Return in a day to challenge me again.
Ready to get a taste of our gym's might? Pulao taught me well, my dragons are sharp!
My dragons held strong this time! Don’t give up—come back fiercer than ever.
Gym Novice: Bryce
Sorry, you're not ready to face the dragons right now.
Blimey, you really cut through my dragon team! Pulao will be proud to see you challenge them!
Dragons need their rest. Come back in a day to challenge me again.
You’ve come far, but my dragons are relentless! Pulao has shown us the meaning of power. Can you endure it?
The dragons proved too much this round. Keep training, and you might stand among legends yet.
Gym Trainer: Valeria
Sorry, you’re not ready to face the dragons right now.
Impressive work! Pulao will want to see what you’re made of next!
Dragons need their rest. Come back in a day to challenge me again.
The path to Pulao is perilous, and so are my dragons! Show me if you’re worthy to meet our leader!
Your team was no match for my dragons! Perhaps more training is needed before you reach Pulao.
Gym Trainer: Daelin
Sorry, you're not ready to face the dragons just now.
Well done! You’ve conquered my dragons and proven your strength. Now, onwards to Pulao!
Dragons need their rest. Come back in a day to challenge me again.
Dragons are not for the faint-hearted. Let’s see if you can withstand their fury before you meet Pulao!
The might of my dragons was too much for you! Train harder before you challenge Pulao!
Gym Veteran: Celina
Sorry, you're not ready to face the dragons right now.
Impressive! Very few stand tall after facing my dragons. Pulao awaits you!
You’ve already battled me today. Come back after a day to challenge me again!
Welcome to the Electric Gym! My Pokémon will give you a shock you won't forget!
Looks like you couldn’t handle my Electric types! Maybe next time.
Gym Novice: Watt
You are unable to battle right now.
You really powered through! Well done, you’re ready for tougher opponents.
You’ve battled me already today. Come back in a day.
Ready to get shocked? If you want to face Leader Tesla, you’ll have to show you can handle my sparks!
That’s what high voltage looks like! Come back when you’re ready for another jolt.
Gym Novice: SlimeyBoi
You look a bit frazzled... none of your Pokémon are able to battle!
Blimey! You grounded my whole team! Looks like you’re ready to take on Tesla now.
Too much energy for one day! Come back in a day if you want another shock.
This gym is crackling with energy! If you want to meet Tesla, you’ll have to weather my storm first!
Did you feel the static? Don’t worry, come back recharged and try again!
Gym Trainer: Roxie
All your Pokémon have fainted! You can’t handle this voltage right now.
You absorbed every zap I had! Tesla’s waiting for a challenger like you.
You’ll have to wait a day before you can challenge me again. Power up and come back!
Electricity is unpredictable, just like my team! If you want to face Tesla, you’ll have to get through me first!
That’s the shocking power of my squad! But keep trying, you’ll get a charge out of it soon.
Gym Trainer: Morgan
All your Pokémon are out of juice! Come back when you’re fully charged.
Wow, you resisted every surge I sent! Tesla’s in for a real test with you.
Sorry, you’re out of challenges for today. Come back in a day for another go!
If you’re aiming to face Tesla, you’ll need to be lightning-fast. Let’s see if you can keep up!
My squad’s speed is hard to match! Don’t give up, you’re getting closer!
Gym Veteran: Sage
Your Pokémon can’t battle right now! Recharge your team and try again.
Impressive! You’ve outsped my team.. you might just give Tesla a real shock!
Even stories need to wait a while before the next chapter. Return in a day to challenge me again!
Only those with a heart as light as a Clefairy's step can outshine the charm and trickery of Fairy-type Pokémon!
Oh dear, it seems the magic wasn’t quite with you this time.
Gym Novice: Rem
Your Pokémon are too tired to dream on... let them rest before facing us!
Well done, dear trainer... your light truly outshone mine.
You’ll need to wait a day before you can take on my magical team again!
The Fairy type is more than just cute—my Pokémon are as tough as they are enchanting! Show me your spirit!
That’s the power of a true fairy tale! Don’t worry, you’ll be ready for the magic soon.
Gym Novice: Opal
Your team can’t keep up with the magic just now. Let them rest before our next battle.
Wow! You broke through my fairy defences... Rosalind will be excited to face you!
The magic will return in a day... come back then if you wish to challenge me!
Welcome to the middle of the fairy ring! If you want to dance with Rosalind, you’ll have to waltz through my team first.
The fairy waltz is tough to follow! Practise your steps and you’ll return stronger.
Gym Trainer: Lila
It looks like your Pokémon are too worn out for a fairy waltz! Come back with renewed spirits.
You’ve mastered the rhythm! Rosalind herself will be eager to meet you.
Every flower needs time to bloom again. Return in a day to challenge me once more!
My fairies are as elegant as they are fierce! Prove your strength if you want to reach Rosalind.
The fairy garden remains closed... for now. Come back when you’re ready for another challenge!
Gym Trainer: Enid
Your Pokémon are too weary for another bloom, let them rest and try again soon.
What a beautiful display of strength! Rosalind will surely look forward to battling you next.
Rest easy... return in a day and my fairies will be ready for you once again!
I’m the last challenge before Rosalind! My fairies will test your heart as well as your strength.
My fairy magic was too much this time! Come back and try again, challenger.
Gym Veteran: Lys
Your team is too tired for another test. Heal up and return when you’re ready.

You and your Pokémon need to rest before taking on my fiery team!

You and your Pokémon need to rest before taking on my fiery team!

Gym Novice: Mezzbeans
Uh oh, looks like your whole team is knocked out. Even my Gengar thinks that's a bit too spooky. Come back when you're ready!

You can only challenge me once a day. Please wait a day before you try again.

You’ve been outmanoeuvred by my spectral squad. Don’t let it haunt you!
Gym Trainer: Seraphina
You’re all out of Pokémon. The afterlife will have to wait for another time!
Impressive! You’re not afraid of ghosts... or a real challenge. Go face Marisol if you dare!
You’ll have to wait a day before I can duel you again. Even spirits get tired!
The veil between worlds is thin in this place... Prepare for a truly haunting battle!
You’ve been overwhelmed by ghostly power. Perhaps you’ll find your courage next time.
Gym Trainer: Vesper
You have no Pokémon left to battle. The afterlife’s doors remain closed... for now.
You conquered the spectral tide! Perhaps you’re ready for the Gym Leader herself.
My ghosts are still resting beyond this realm. You must wait a day before we clash again!
When brightest it's darkest, when darkest it's gone. When gone forever, so is your victory, trainer. Let's see if you can shine down upon these shadows, lest you fall and lose your way among them.
Unfortunate trainer, it seems the darkness has engulfed what little light you had. Don't give up just yet, even the most menacing of shadows can be defeated.
Gym Veteran: Sam
You have no Pokémon left. Return when you are stronger, trainer, otherwise the spirits will overwhelm you.

I admire your courage, trainer, you've managed to navigate your way through this gloomy challenge. Continue doing so, and you'll be able to conquer any darkness that threatens the shine of your brilliance.
Nature needs time to recover. Come back in a day to face me again!
Hello there, sunshine! Ready to get tangled up in my little garden of surprises? No pressure, but if you lose, you will have to help me repot my Oddish. Deal?
Don't be discouraged! Every defeat is just an opportunity to learn and grow stronger. And look on the bright side—now you get to help me repot Oddish! ...What? A deal’s a deal!
Gym Novice: Lethe
Sorry, but you can’t take root in this battle just yet.
Losses are just the universe’s way of saying, ‘Try again with more sparkle!’ ...Right? Note to self: More training, less talking to my Roserade about her life dreams.
We’ve just finished... I had a fun time but you’ll have to wait a day before we can treat ourselves to another battle!
You think you’re good enough to challenge our Leader? Let’s find out if you break like a branch or stand tall like a tree.
Looks like you would benefit from some more training. You can try again later, but for now make like a tree and leave.
Gym Novice: Aida
Your team isn't looking too treemendous, come back when they're all oaky dokey.
Unbeleafable! You'll leaf a lasting impression on me, but perhaps you can take on Leader Heath after all!
Give the field a rest! Try again in a day.
Ready for a wild ride? My team will show you the power of nature’s tricks!
The forest stands strong! Return when you’re ready.
Gym Trainer: Eric
You need a bit more sun to challenge me!
Well done! You’ve cut a path right through my garden.
You still have to wait a day before you can challenge me again. Stop and smell the roses!
Watch out for the thorns on your way to Leader Heath!
Better luck next time! Tend to your Pokémon like a beautiful flower and you'll be ready to take on Leader Heath
Gym Trainer: Rose
Your party's not ready to navigate this garden! Take them to a Pokémon Centre!
Ouch, guess your thorns were sharper than mine! Leader Heath is waiting!
You’ll need to wait a day before challenging me again!
You’d better hold your breath... Breloom’s about to put spores in the air and you on the floor!
You’ve got potential. Just need to stop sleeping on it.
Gym Veteran: Fig
Come back when you have healthy Pokémon to battle with!
Wow, your team mowed right through mine! Heath might have some real competition.
You’ll need to wait a day before you can challenge me again. The ground never stops shifting, but you can always return!

Down you go! The ground can swallow up even the toughest challengers. Better luck next time!
Gym Novice: Reed
Your Pokémon aren’t able to battle right now. Rest up and come back strong!
Wow, you managed to keep your footing! That was impressive. You’re ready for even tougher ground battles ahead!
You’ve got to wait a day before you challenge me again. The ground may seem still, but it’s always moving!
Let’s see if you can handle a real ground-type rumble! I don’t go easy on anyone, so bring your best!
That’s how it’s done! You’ve got to dig deep if you want to beat me. Better luck next time!
Gym Novice: Daria
Looks like your Pokémon need a break. Heal them up and come back ready to dig in!
I’m impressed, you outlasted my toughest ground Pokémon! Keep up the momentum!
Not so fast! You’ve got to wait a day before taking me on again. Give those Pokémon a rest.
Leader Clayton sets the bar pretty high in this Gym! But first, you’ll have to get past my ground-types before you even think about challenging him.
The ground beneath you just gave way! Don’t worry... every fall is a chance to climb back up.
Gym Trainer: Orin
Your team isn’t ready for another tough ground battle. Come back when your Pokémon are good to go!
Nice work! If you can handle my team, perhaps you’re ready to take on Clayton himself!
Whoa! Take a breather. Wait a day before you come at me again. Even the toughest trainers need rest!
You've nearly reached Leader Clayton, but I'm the last wall of earth you have to break through. Ready for one more rumble?
The earth doesn't yield so easily! Don’t give up, Clayton is waiting for the best challengers.
Gym Trainer: Terra
Your Pokémon need more time to recover. Heal up and return when you’re ready for the final ground trial!
You’ve proven yourself on every level! Leader Clayton won’t know what’s hit him!
Hold on! You’ll have to wait a day before you can have another go at my team. Even the ground needs time to recover!
This is it! Clayton’s waiting, but first you have to get through me and my sturdy ground-types!
You’ve been stopped just short of the leader! Go train up, and try again, Clayton’s not going anywhere!
Gym Veteran: Shale
Your Pokémon are worn out. Heal them up, then come back for one last showdown!
You’re ready! Head on to Leader Clayton... he’ll give you the battle of a lifetime!
I've already battled you today! You'll need to wait a day before facing me again.
The cold in this gym is nothing compared to my battling spirit! You'll need to freeze out all doubt if you want to impress Leader Frostine!
Brrr... the cold must have got to you! Try again when you're feeling up to the challenge!
Gym Novice: Eira
You can't battle if all your Pokémon are fainted! Come back when your team is ready to take on the ice.
Now that was a battle worthy of the Ice Gym! Leader Frostine would be proud, well done!
You’ll have to wait a day before you can face me again. The ice must settle!
Welcome to the frozen hall of battle. Ice doesn’t shatter easily... let’s see if you do.
The chill runs deeper than you expected. Come back when your resolve is as unbreakable as the frost if you wish to make it to Frostine.
Gym Novice: Lunaris
All your Pokémon have fainted! Come back when your team is ready to chill with the best.
The frost may be eternal... but so is your will. You’ve earnt this victory.
I’ve already battled you today! The ice is slippery, so come back in a day.
Getting colder, aren’t you? You’re almost at the heart of the Ice Gym, but you’ll have to skate past me first if you want to reach Leader Frostine!
The frost can be unforgiving! Warm up and return when you’re ready.
Gym Trainer: Niv
If your Pokémon are all fainted, you can’t challenge the Ice Gym! Heal up and have another go.
You breezed right past my icy defences! Leader Frostine will be waiting for you!
You’ll have to wait a day before you can try again. The ice must reset!
You’ve made it far, but the final test before Frostine won’t be easy! Let’s see if your skills can break the ice!
Frozen out? Don’t let it get you down... practice makes perfect!
Gym Trainer: Elsa
You can’t challenge me if your Pokémon have all fainted! Get them healed up and come back strong.
What a battle! You’re ready for Leader Frostine’s chilling might!
You’ll have to wait a day before challenging me again. The snow needs time to settle!
You’re on the last stretch! If you can break through my team, you’ll be ready for Frostine’s icy challenge.
That’s where your journey ends... for now! Train hard and come back stronger.
Gym Veteran: Chione
You can’t battle with all your Pokémon fainted! Heal up and try again.
You’ve conquered the final snowdrift! Leader Frostine awaits, good luck!
You’ll have to wait a day before you can try again. My Steel-types need a breather!
My Pokémon are tough as nails! Think you can dent my defences?
I have found the chink in your armour!
Gym Novice: Ingot
Come back when your Pokémon are ready for another go!
Impressive! You broke through my defence. Leader Ferrum is next... if you think you’re ready!
You still have to wait a day before you can challenge me again. Let the forge heat up first!
Only trainers with iron-clad skill can reach Ferrum! Let's test your melting point!
Unlucky. With a bit more honing, your team will be sharp enough to face Ferrum!
Gym Novice: Cen
Your party couldn't break through paper, let alone steel! Take them to a Pokémon Centre!
Solid as steel! Strike while the iron is hot, and confront Ferrum!
We need a break to repair and sharpen up! Come back in a day.
You’re almost to Ferrum, but can you stand up to my impenetrable wall of Steel-types?
My defences held strong! You’ll have to rethink your strategy.
Gym Trainer: Alloy
Don’t push your Pokémon too hard! Rest up and try again.
Unbelievable! You pierced my defences, maybe you do have what it takes for the Steel Gym Leader.
You’ll need to wait a day before you can face me again. Every metal needs to cool down!
Shining bright and sharp... my Steel-types are ready to show you their brilliance!
Your strength wasn’t enough to outshine my Steel-types!
Gym Trainer: Chrome
Your team is worn out! Rest up and then come back for a proper battle.
Your victory sparkles like polished chrome! Ferrum will be waiting for you.
We need time to recover our edge! Try again in a day.
Swift as liquid metal and strong as steel... my team won’t make this easy for you!
My steel resolve melted away... Well battled!
Gym Veteran: Mercury
Don’t burn out! Get your Pokémon healed up and ready for another round.
Amazing! You’ve got what it takes to face Leader Ferrum, go claim your destiny!
You’ll have to wait a day before we can battle again. The waves don’t wait for anyone!
You’ve made it this far, but can you impress Gym Leader Nereus? Show me what you’ve got, challenger!
Looks like the tides weren’t in your favour. Train a bit more, and maybe Nereus will see your true strength next time.
Gym Novice: Kai
Looks like your team needs to dry off. Come back once they’re ready!
Wow, impressive! If you can handle me, perhaps you’re ready to face Gym Leader Nereus!
You’ll have to wait a day before we can battle again. The waves don’t wait for anyone!
Ready to dive into a tough match? Let's see how you handle the current!
Not bad! Try again whenever you’re ready.
Gym Novice: Mira
Looks like your team needs to dry off. Come back once they’re ready!
Nice battling! You’re making waves in this gym.
You’ll have to wait a day before we can battle again. The waves don’t wait for anyone!
You’ve made it this far? Impressive! But to reach Nereus, you’ll have to get past me first!
Keep at it! Even the best swimmers have to practise before they master the waves.
Gym Trainer: Brook
Looks like your team needs to dry off. Come back once they’re ready!
You surged right through my team! Maybe you're ready for the leader.
You’ll have to wait a day before we can battle again. The waves don’t wait for anyone!
Don't let the gentle waves fool you. I'm ready to battle any time!
Whew, tough tides today! Rest up and try again when you're ready.
Gym Trainer: Nadia
Looks like your team needs to dry off. Come back once they’re ready!
Wow, you really ride the waves! Best of luck against our leader!
My team needs time to recharge their brilliance. Try again in a day, when the lights are just right!
You think you’ve seen everything the Water Gym can throw at you? Wait until you see how I reflect your moves!
Sometimes the light just isn’t on your side. Don’t worry... come back and shine even brighter next time!
Gym Veteran: Iris
You can’t battle me if your team is out of power! Restore your Pokémon and return for a dazzling match.
Wow! Your moves lit up the battlefield, like a ray tracing through water!

pixelmon.research.objective.battle.gym.d: %player_name%, welcome to the Dragon Gym! The battles begin at level 50, so make sure your team is ready for a challenge. Dragons are known for their speed and tricky tactics... keep your wits about you, and don’t be afraid to try something unexpected. Best of luck!
Great work, %player_name%! You’re off to a strong start, but the next trainers won’t make it easy. Watch out for unexpected moves and sturdy defences ahead. Keep adapting, you’ve got this!
Impressive, %player_name%! Only Celina stands between you and the leader. She’s a true veteran. Expect fierce tactics and powerful moves. Give it your all!

You’ve surpassed Celina, %player_name%... an achievement few can claim. Now, only Pulao stands between you and glory. Be especially wary of Pulao’s Dragapult; it’s said to strike as swiftly as lightning and vanish just as quickly. Trust your instincts, stay focused, and give it everything you’ve got!
Defeat Pulao, the Dragon Gym Leader

Incredible work, %player_name%! You’ve claimed the Legend Badge and proven yourself among the best. Pulao also wants me to give you this TM - Dragon Pulse. Let its power remind you of the strength and spirit you’ve shown today. I couldn’t be prouder!
pixelmon.research.objective.battle.gym.e: %player_name%, welcome to the Electric Gym! Battles start at level 50, so check your team’s readiness before you spark things up. Electric-types are quick and can surprise you with a few tricks. Keep your footing and stay flexible. You’ve got this!
Nicely done, %player_name%! The next opponents are clever and fast—be ready for changes in tempo and a few jolts along the way. Keep adapting and don’t lose your spark!

Fantastic work, %player_name%! Only Sage stands before the leader now. Expect clever defences and a few surprises, this veteran knows how to keep challengers on their toes. Trust your instincts and push forward!

Outstanding, %player_name%! You’ve reached the final test: Tesla, the Electric Gym Leader. Keep an eye out for Tesla’s Alolan Raichu... its speed and psychic power are truly electrifying. Stay sharp, trust your strategy, and light up the arena!
Defeat Tesla, the Electric Gym Leader

You did it, %player_name%! With the Bolt Badge in hand, you’ve shown you can handle any challenge that comes your way, even in the thick of the storm. Tesla was impressed by your ingenuity and asked me to pass along a Thunder TM as an extra reward. Channel its energy and keep chasing new horizons!
pixelmon.research.objective.battle.gym.f: %player_name%, welcome to the Fairy Gym! Battles begin at level 50, so be sure your team is prepared. Fairy-types can be dazzling and tricky, but a bit of Steel or Poison in your line-up might just keep you grounded. Trust your instincts and let the magic unfold!
Defeat Gym Novice Rem
Defeat Gym Novice Opal

Great progress, %player_name%! Your next challengers are as crafty as they are charming. Don’t be surprised if things get a bit unpredictable. Adapt quickly, and don’t let the fairy dust cloud your strategy!
Defeat Gym Trainer Lila
Defeat Gym Trainer Enid

Only one stands between you and the Fairy Gym Leader now... Veteran Lys. Their team is known for putting up barriers and turning battles in their favour. Stay patient, trust your team, and remember: every trick has its counter!
Defeat Gym Veteran Lys

You’ve made it to the heart of the Fairy Gym %player_name%! Rosalind’s team is famous for their dazzling synergy and a certain Mawile with truly fearsome strength. Trust your intuition, let your team’s bond shine, and don’t be afraid to think outside the fairy ring. You’re almost there!
Defeat Rosalind, the Fairy Gym Leader

Congratulations %player_name%! With the Fairy Badge, you’ve proven your heart and mind can weather any enchantment. Rosalind was so impressed, she insisted you receive this TM: Misty Explosion. May its power help your team shine even brighter on your journey ahead!

%player_name%, welcome to the Fire Gym! The matches start at level 50, so make sure your team is ready for the heat. Fire-types love to pile on pressure. Having a solid defence or a way to dampen the flames can go a long way, so stay cool and burn bright!
Defeat Gym Novice Ember
Defeat Gym Novice Cindy

Impressive work so far, %player_name%! The next trainers burn bright and hit fast, so expect sudden shifts in momentum and plenty of heat. A steady defence or a way to clear the field might just keep you ahead. Keep your focus blazing!
Defeat Gym Trainer Seara
Defeat Gym Trainer Sol

You’re almost through the flames, %player_name%! Veteran Ashen stands between you and the Fire Gym Leader, and their team is as relentless as a summer heatwave. Prepare for both blistering attacks and a battlefield that’s tough to cross!
Defeat Gym Veteran Ashen

%player_name%, you’ve made it this far, and Pyra’s just ahead. Her passion for Fire-types is legendary... watch out for that Charizard, it’s her pride and joy. Stay calm under pressure, trust your choices, and don’t let the heat get to you.
Defeat Pyra, the Fire Gym Leader

You did it, %player_name%! With the Volcano Badge in hand, you’ve proven you can handle even the hottest challenges. Pyra was genuinely impressed, and she asked me to give you TM Fire Blast. Use its power wisely, and keep that spark alive as you move forward!
pixelmon.research.objective.battle.gym.g: Welcome to the Ghost Gym, %player_name%. These battles begin at level 50, beneath the shroud of the Midnight Veil. Ghost-types are masters of misdirection, so keep your mind clear and your team steady. A strong spirit and perhaps a way to break through their tricks will serve you well here.
Defeat Gym Novice Eule
Defeat Gym Novice Mezzbeans

Nicely done, %player_name%. You’ve seen the first glimpses of what lies in the mist. The next trainers may try to unsettle your plan... keep your wits about you and don’t be afraid to challenge their illusions.
Defeat Gym Trainer Seraphina
Defeat Gym Trainer Vesper

Only one challenge stands between you and Marisol now. Sam’s ghosts are cunning and love to turn the tide with a single move. Trust in your own strategy, %player_name%, and don’t let your guard down for even a moment.
Defeat Gym Veteran Sam

You’ve come this far, %player_name%, and now Marisol awaits. Her connection with her team runs deep, and her Mimikyu is especially notorious for surviving the first blow and turning battles around. Stay calm, play smart, and let your courage light the way through the fog.
Defeat Marisol, the Ghost Gym Leader

Congratulations, %player_name%! You’ve claimed the Fog Badge and proven yourself through the mist and mystery. Marisol was truly impressed, and she’s asked me to give you TM Shadow Ball. May it guide you when things seem uncertain, and remind you of your own resolve.

Welcome to the Grass Gym, %player_name%. These battles start at level 50, deep within the heart of the Verdant Wilds. Grass-types thrive on resilience and sneaky status moves, so a little patience and something sharp to cut through their recovery could go a long way. Trust your roots and keep growing!
Defeat Gym Novice Lethe
Defeat Gym Novice Aida
Nice work, %player_name%! You’ve weathered the first burst of leaves. Don’t let your guard down... the next trainers love to sap your strength and stall for time. Stay alert and keep your momentum.
Defeat Gym Trainer Eric
Defeat Gym Trainer Rose

Only one veteran stands between you and the Gym Leader now, %player_name%. Watch out for disruptive moves and tricky abilities, as sometimes the most stubborn weeds hide the sharpest thorns. Stick to your plan and don’t let them entangle you.
Defeat Gym Veteran Fig

You’ve made it to the final stretch, %player_name%. Heath’s bond with his Grass-types runs deep; his Ferrothorn in particular is legendary for wearing challengers down. Keep your wits about you, play to your strengths, and show them you’re ready to blossom.
Defeat Heath, the Grass Gym Leader

Congratulations, %player_name%! The Plant Badge is yours! You’ve shown you can adapt and thrive, no matter how wild the field. Heath was truly impressed and asked me to give you this TM-Energy Ball. Use it to let your team flourish wherever you go!

Welcome to the Ground Gym, %player_name%. These battles start at level 50, right in the heart of the Shifting Sands. Ground-types hit hard and play rough. Having a way to dodge status and stay nimble can make all the difference. Tread carefully and keep your footing firm.
Defeat Gym Novice Reed
Defeat Gym Novice Daria
Nice work, %player_name%! You’ve held steady through the first tremors. The next trainers may try to bog you down with hazards or chip damage... don’t lose your momentum and stay on your toes.
Defeat Gym Trainer Orin
Defeat Gym Trainer Terra

You’ve made it deep into the shifting sands, %player_name%. The next battles can wear you down with rough terrain and tricky tactics. Don’t get caught off guard by a sudden sandstorm or an unexpected strike. Steady nerves win these matches.
Defeat Gym Veteran Shale

Only Clayton remains now, and he’s got a reputation for turning matches around with a single move. Watch that Excadrill of his, as it’s been known to sweep the unwary. Trust your instincts, %player_name%, and don’t let the ground shift beneath your feet.
Defeat Clayton, the Ground Gym Leader

Well done, %player_name%! Earning the Quake Badge means you held your ground where others have faltered. Clayton wanted you to have this: TM Earthquake. Let its power remind you that even the sturdiest obstacles can be broken with determination.
pixelmon.research.objective.battle.gym.i: Welcome to the Ice Gym, %player_name%. The challenge begins at level 50, where every step crunches under fresh snow. Ice-types love to punish reckless moves and can freeze you in your tracks, so bring some reliable coverage and keep your team warm!

Nicely done, %player_name%! The first battles can be slippery, but you kept your footing. The next trainers may set up veils or try to wear you down... don’t let their cold tactics catch you off guard. Stay sharp and press on.

You’re really braving the blizzard now, %player_name%. Some Ice-types love to hide behind screens or chip away with hail. Keeping hazards clear and holding onto momentum will be key as you press deeper into the storm.

Almost there, %player_name%! All that’s left is Frostine, whose Weavile is famous for its blistering speed and sharp claws. Don’t let your guard down. You’d better strike quickly or set a trap before the snow settles...
Defeat Frostine, the Ice Gym Leader

Oh, %player_name%, you absolutely did it! The Icicle Badge is yours, and I’m honestly not even surprised, but I am SO proud! Frostine told me herself that your strategy was a blizzard all its own, and she’s asked me to pass on this TM for Ice Beam, which is—oh, just such a classic, I use it all the time for fieldwork and you should see the results... anyway! Keep that badge shiny, try not to freeze any wildflowers with that new move, and get ready for the next challenge because I have a feeling you’re just getting started! Seriously, amazing work!
pixelmon.research.objective.battle.gym.s: Ah, %player_name%, you’ve made it to the Steel Gym! Battles here begin at level 50, right in the shadow of roaring forges and gleaming metal. Steel-types are all about defence and tricky resistances, as they’ll shrug off hits that would stop most challengers cold! Pack a little Fire, maybe a dash of Ground or Fighting, and remember: sometimes brains beat brawn.

Steel-strong, %player_name%! That was a textbook start. Watch out: the next trainers might layer hazards or hunker down with their defensive tricks. Don’t let their armour get to you. Stay clever, chip away at their shields, and remember, even the toughest steel has its weak point.

The heat’s on now, %player_name%! Trainers this deep in the gym know all about setting traps and wearing down opponents—expect lots of spikes, screens, and maybe a cheeky Knock Off. Make sure you keep your field clear and don’t let them slow you down. You’re slicing right through that armour!

Okay, deep breath, %player_name%... now it’s just Mercury standing between you and the leader. I’ll be honest, I still remember the first time I battled Mercury. It wasn't even close. He swept me off my feet with that relentless offence and steel-tight defence! Expect some really clever pivots and more than a few Iron Heads, and don’t be surprised if his Jirachi starts flinching its way through trouble. Stay flexible, be ready for sudden pressure, and show Mercury your own steel resolve!
Defeat Ferrum, the Steel Gym Leader

Oh my goodness, %player_name%, look at you! Coal Badge in hand, and I swear I nearly dropped my clipboard watching that match! Ferrum’s team is built like a fortress but you just kept finding cracks, and I’m thrilled, seriously, thrilled to hand you TM Iron Head, one of my absolute favourite moves, so reliable, I taught it to a Klinklang once and it swept a regional! Anyway, polish that badge, try not to dent it, and get ready because you’re really rolling now – onward, onward!
pixelmon.research.objective.battle.gym.w: Oh, %player_name%, welcome to the Water Gym! The first thing you’ll notice is the air in here... cool, salty, and just a little bit electric with excitement. Battles here start at level 50, and Water-types love to shift tempo, soak up hits, and counterattack when you least expect it. If you’ve got any Grass or Electric-types itching for action, this is their moment to shine! And keep an eye out, as rain might change the whole game. Let’s make some waves!

Nice work, %player_name%! You handled those first waves beautifully. The next trainers love their weather tricks, so don’t be surprised if it starts pouring mid-battle or if you get caught by a surprise Hurricane. Stay nimble, and remember: you can always ride the current instead of fighting it head-on!

You’re already making ripples, %player_name%! Iris is the last one standing before the leader, and they're famous for turning the tide with a single move. Expect slippery switches, annoying status effects, and don’t be afraid to get a little creative with your type match-ups, because sometimes the best counter isn’t the obvious one!

Whoa, %player_name%, I could practically hear the roar of the crowd from here! Iris doesn’t go down easily... their Starmie in particular has dashed a lot of hopes with its speed and coverage. Now it’s just you and Nereus, who’s practically part-merman if you ask me. I’m bouncing in my seat, honestly. Take a deep breath, trust your reads, and get ready for the fiercest waters yet!
Defeat Nereus, the Water Gym Leader

You did it, %player_name%! You made it through torrents, whirlpools, and more status moves than I’ve seen in a month! Nereus was actually grinning when he handed over the Wave Badge, which he basically never does, and he’s asked me to pass along TM Scald... I once used it on a Milotic to win a faculty tournament but that’s a story for another time! Keep that badge shining and keep your strategy flowing, because you’re absolutely making a splash on this journey!
gui.jei.category.pixelmon.infuser.juice_: Color depends on berries used, and may not match what is shown in this UI.
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.shopkeeper.utility: As you can see, my hobby is to collect rare items!
If you ever change your mind, will you sell me the rare item? Will you?
pixelmon.npc.dialogue.battle.trainer.are: Hi! I'm Alice from Argentite Valley! Tesla says I need to practise before joining the gym. Let's see if you know how fast Electric types can be!
Zap! Speed wins battles! Remember, Electric moves crush Water and Flying types!
Alice
Whoa... you're quick! Maybe ask Sage for tips—she taught me Ground types block our shocks!
Volta, at your service! I train here daily to impress Gym Leader Tesla. Let me show you how Electric types control the battlefield!
Well fought! Pro tip: Always have a plan for Ground type
Volta
Impressive... You might rival Roxie soon! But remember: status moves like Thunder Wave win long battles!
I'm Carter! Tesla says I fight like Roxie – all thunder and no restraint. Let's see if you can handle voltage!
Overwhelming power wins! Remember: Electric hits like a lorry against Water and Flying!
Carte
Volt switch! Maybe I SHOULD learn restrain
Rex, reporting! Sage taught me battles are won with brains, not just bolts. Let's analyse your strategy!
Strategic superiority! Note: Volt Absorb Pokémon like Lanturn heal from Electric moves!
Rex
Fascinating! You exploited my type weaknesse
Lucie, Tesla's apprentice! Sage says terrain wins wars. Let me demonstrate Electric Terrain dominance!
Precision over power! Remember: Rotom forms bypass Ground weaknesses - study Tesla's ace team!
Lucie
Magnificent! You countered my terrain!
I'm Marlon! Roxie helped me modify these Pokémon. Let's test my paralysis-stall tech!
Status effects win wars! Freeze Dry Lanturn wrecks Ground-types - tell Watt to give it a go!
Marlon
Short-circuit! Your type coverage beat my tech
Hi! I'm Chloe from Rosealite Town! Fairy-types thrive on patience and clever timing—like how Clefairy's Encore can trap reckless opponents. Let me show you!
See? Status moves like Charm weaken attackers, giving us time to heal! Enid taught me tha
Chloe
Oh... I forgot Steel-types resist us! Always check type matchups—Arena Instructor said I overlook tha
Yo! I’m Tierno! Battling’s like dancing—timing is everything! Mawile’s Intimidate lowers your attack before we strike. Ready to groove?
Haha! Abilities like Mimikyu’s Disguise give free setup turns! Opal still can’t counter tha
Tierno
Whoa! You predicted my heals... Suppose I shouldn’t spam Life Dew when poisoned. Rosalind would’ve dodged that!
Hii! I'm Shauna! Gym Novice Opal says Fairy-types need balance—like how Mawile's Intimidate softens physical hits before we strike!
Yay! Draining Kiss heals whilst damaging, perfect for drawn-out fights! I'm totally telling Opal about this strategy!
Shauna
Aww... I forgot Poison-types ignore Misty Terrain's status protection. Rosalind would say I got too excited
Bonjour. I'm Miette. Let me demonstrate why disruption wins battles... Klefki's Prankster paralyses foes before they ac
Observe: Mimikyu's Disguise enables free Swords Dance setups. Lys underestimated that once... never again
Miette
Hmph. Steel-types neutralise our abilities... I'll revise my notes. Instructor, if you're watching... this was intentional
I'm Dawn! After Rosalind swept my team, I learned dual-types are key. See how Togekiss's Air Slash flinches with Serene Grace?
Coordinated strikes win! Mawile's Intimidate softened you up for Azumarill's Aqua Jet. Lys taught me that!
Dawn
I forgot Steel resists Fairy... Instructor warned me about coverage moves!
Hi! I'm Bianca from Professor Juniper's lab! Let me demonstrate how abilities like Prankster make status moves strike first!
See? Magic Bounce reflects hazards back! I wish Gym Novice Opal understood how abilities counter her strategie
Bianca
Oh dear... Neutralising Gas cancelled my Prankster. Rosalind always says to read the ability dex entries!
Warren here from Carnelia Town! Watch how Flame Body punishes physical attackers!
Eviolite makes Pignite nearly unbreakable after Bulk Up! Novice Ingot always underestimates unevolved Pokémon!
Warren
Water types... Should've kept Rotom in longe
I'm Cinder! Drought from Vulpix powers up our Fire moves... Trainer Chrome says weather can win battles!
Flash Fire absorbs their Fire attacks to boost ours!
Cinde
Rock coverage... Armarouge's Weak Armour backfired. Cen would've predicted th
Sapphire! Gale Wings gives Fletchinder priority... Veteran Mercury says speed controls battles!
Iron Fist boosts Monferno's punches by 20%! Our Instructor says abilities make all the difference!
Sapphire
Ground moves... Hisuian Arcanine couldn't outspeed. Alloy warned me about coverage
Bridget here! Intimidate weakens physical attackers; watch how Arcanine controls the battlefield!
Parting Shot lowers stats whilst switching!
Bridge

Aiden! Unaware Skeledirge ignores stat boosts!
Flame Body singes physical attackers... 30% chance wins matches! Leader Ferrum taught me this!
Aiden
Water coverage... Typhlosion's Eruption wasn't enough
Ashton! Nasty Plot boosts Delphox's Sp.Atk sharply
Torch Song increases Skeledirge's Sp.Atk with each use, it's unstoppable momentum!

Dragon types... Turtonator's Shell Armour wasn't enough
Come back in an hour!
Your team must not exceed level 25 for this training!
Hah! Village training builds real endurance! Remember that high Defence Pokémon like my Geodude can withstand hits while you plan!
Victory through perseverance! Always check your opponent's ability before attacking!
Level 25

You... broke through my guard? Impressive! Remember to switch Pokémon when abilities like Sand Veil activate!
Burn bright or burn out! My Vulpix shows Fire isn't just offence, Flash Fire absorbs fire moves!

Battle is like a dance! My Espeon uses Synchronize to share status effects, so poison your foe carefully!

Level 35

Your rhythm overwhelmed me... Remember to use nature advantages... my Jolteon fears Ground moves!
Observation is key! My Bronzong's Heatproof reduces fire damage, make sure to always check abilities!
Data wins battles! Levitate Pokémon avoids Ground moves so exploit type gaps!
Roman
Fascinating! Your unpredictability beat my calculations. Remember: natures like Modest boost special attacks!
Your team must not exceed level 45 for this training!
True beauty lies in synergy! My Milotic's Marvel Scale boosts Defence when statused!
Perfection! Held items like Leftovers provide passive healing!
Level 45

Angie

Storm Drain redirects Water attacks. Gastrodon hard-counters Novice Daria's strategie

Stealth Rock punishes switches; Gym Trainer Orin uses this to control battles!
Nando

See? Sturdy ability prevents OHKOs. Novice Ingot always forgets about this!

Mien. Gym Trainer Chrome says Prankster Klefki sets screens before opponents act... observe!
Perfect! Leech Seed + Iron Barbs drains health while Ferroseed protects itself!

Ground-types... Cufant's Dig came too late. Novice Cen would've predicted th

pixelmon.battle.tier.ag.description: AG (Anything Goes) is the base rule set used for all battles.\nAny Pokémon is allowed in the battle, with any combinations of moves, and abilities.\nAs the title suggests, there are absolutely no restrictions on the battle in this rule se
pixelmon.battle.tier.ag.double.descripti:
AG (Anything Goes) is the base rule set used for all battles.
Any Pokémon is allowed in the battle, with any combinations of moves, and abilities.
As the title suggests, there are absolutely no restrictions on the battle in this rule set.
This is for a double battle
pixelmon.battle.tier.uber.description:
Uber is a highly inclusive battle rule set.
 
Restrictions:
 Species Clause - A player cannot have two Pokémon with the same National Pokédex number
 
 Evasion Clause - A Pokémon may not have either Double Team or Minimize in its moveset
 
 OHKO Clause - A Pokémon may not have the moves Fissure, Guillotine, Horn Drill, or Sheer Cold in its movese
pixelmon.battle.tier.uber.double.descrip:
Uber is a highly inclusive battle rule set.
This is for a double battle.
 
Restrictions:
 Species Clause - A player cannot have two Pokémon with the same National Pokédex number
 
 Evasion Clause - A Pokémon may not have either Double Team or Minimize in its moveset
 
 OHKO Clause - A Pokémon may not have the moves Fissure, Guillotine, Horn Drill, or Sheer Cold in its movese
